body:
# Bug Report

## Description

There are 2 places where account can be renamed and both have different rules.

## Steps to reproduce

Wallet view edit
1. Go to wallet screen
2. Right click `Status account` -> Press edit
3. Try add any character or just add space.

Settings edit
1. Go to settings -> Wallet
2. Press any account
3. Click edit icon
4. Spaces and special characters can be added

#### Expected behavior

Wallet account rename is consistent through whole application

#### Actual behavior

![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/11396062/fe821aba-6979-497f-8ef0-1fbac9120f0e)

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version:  master

There is one more place where you can set an account name, that's when you're adding it, but basically add account popup and edit account popup from the wallet section share the same logic, which by my opinion should be the correct one, cause that's what figma says about requirements.

Wallet settings part is not redone yet to align with new wallet settings part designed in fimga, so once that's done it will be the same.

But one thing more which we should check is what are the set requirements in mobile app (if they are not the same we are in a problem again).

Hey @Cuteivist, @saledjenic is correct, the validation in the add flow should match that in the edit flow. Both flows should allow the user to add a space in the account name. The things we validate against that are not allowed are: - Name length >20 chars - Use of special characters - Use of emojis - Where the name, emoji and colour of account are all the same as another account `Wallet v2` desktop designs (where we detail the account name validation in full) https://www.figma.com/file/FkFClTCYKf83RJWoifWgoX/Wallet-v2?type=design&node-id=12322-276497&t=FtIXdCmy5P9mwadY-4 The mobile designs follow the desktop designs on this and should be consistent (I see a couple of validation states currently missing in the mobile designs but when they are taken into the UI design phase these should be added). https://www.figma.com/file/Q92CTbwanXZwSWrHWKfJqS/Wallet-UX-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=3258-493247&t=NW34ozUYZ14epE2Z-4 The user can change the account name from wallet settings as well, but we just launch the same edit dialog shown in the `Wallet v2` file - so in the settings file, we just link back to `Wallet v2`: https://www.figma.com/file/idUoxN7OIW2Jpp3PMJ1Rl8/%E2%9A%99%EF%B8%8F-Settings-%7C-Desktop?type=design&node-id=15264-365634&t=fCeOLj4DMXZznv0z-4 Hope that helps clarify @Cuteivist , just shout if not :)
